results.title: Music World Bands Together Against YouTube, Seeking Change to Law
results.abstract: The industry has asked the government to modify the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, saying it is outdated and makes removing unauthorized content too difficult.

multimedia.caption: Stars like Pharrell Williams have signed letters asking for changes to copyright laws.
Stars like Pharrell Williams have signed letters asking for changes to copyright laws.

Stars like Pharrell Williams have signed letters asking for changes to copyright laws.

results.title: Rise of Ad-Blocking Software Threatens Online Revenue
results.abstract: A report suggests that one in five smartphone users worldwide deploys software to remove ads when he or she browses the web.

results.title: Dell Buyout Deal Shortchanged Shareholders, Court Rules
results.abstract: The court found that Dell shares were worth about $17.62 at the time of the 2013 buyout, not the $13.75 that Michael S. Dell and Silver Lake paid.
results.byline: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

results.title: Online Shareholder Meetings Lower Costs, but Also Interaction
results.abstract: Done in person, the annual meeting is the sole opportunity that all shareholders have to meet and talk with management.

results.title: Snowden Leaks Illegal but Were ‘a Public Service,’ Eric Holder Says
results.abstract: The former attorney general credited Edward J. Snowden with raising the debate on national security, though he called his actions “inappropriate and illegal.”

results.title: Stephen Hawking Calls Donald Trump a ‘Demagogue’
results.abstract: The British physicist said that the Republican candidate for president was an impenetrable mystery.

results.title: Software for Stopping Freedom
results.abstract: Software companies are selling spying and hacking tools to governments interested in quashing human-rights workers, political dissidents and journalists.

results.title: Getting Up Close With the iOS Camera
results.abstract: Apple’s built-in camera app for its iOS devices includes controls for zooming and other fine-tuning — if you know where to tap.

multimedia.caption: When using the iOS 9 Camera app, pinch your fingers on the screen to see a zoom slider appear. You can adjust the exposure by tapping an area of the screen and sliding the sun icon up or down.

results.title: Mumbai Police Ask for Video Mocking Celebrities to Be Deleted
results.abstract: After receiving complaints from politicians, officers said they had asked Facebook and YouTube to remove a video mocking a cricket star and a Bollywood singer.
results.byline: By NIDA NAJAR and SUHASINI RAJ

multimedia.caption: Lata Mangeshkar, who has sung the vocals for Bollywood heroines for decades, at an award ceremony in Hyderabad, India, in 2010. The Indian police have asked for a comedian’s video, which mocks the singer, to be removed from the web.

results.title: A Universal Basic Income Is a Poor Tool to Fight Poverty
results.abstract: In this world where work remains an important social, psychological and economic anchor, there are better tools to help than giving every American a monthly check.

multimedia.caption: A person in a robot costume at the World Economic Forum in Davos in January promoted the basic income referendum in Switzerland.

results.title: Suppressing Facebook’s ‘Memories’
results.abstract: The social network routinely invites users to nostalgically review older timeline posts, but not everyone wants to be reminded of the past.

results.title: When a Robot Books Your Airline Ticket
results.abstract: Virtual travel assistant services designed to understand conversational language are expected to change the way travel is planned.

results.title: Effort to Expose Russia’s ‘Troll Army’ Draws Vicious Retaliation
results.abstract: Finland is an active front in an online “information war” between Russia and the West. When a journalist there confronted pro-Putin agitators, she became a target.

multimedia.caption: Jessikka Aro, right, a journalist in Finland, was harassed after reporting on the rise of abusive pro-Russian posts on the Internet.

results.title: A Mission to Bring STEM Skills, and Robots, to Children in West Africa
results.abstract: A Nebraska professor who returns home to Senegal to start a robotics competition hopes to instill a drive in schoolchildren to improve their world.

results.title: Governments Turn to Commercial Spyware to Intimidate Dissidents
results.abstract: Surveillance and hacking tools are becoming increasingly popular among a wide range of nations, many of which use the methods to monitor, silence and punish their critics.
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

multimedia.caption: Bill Marczak, a senior fellow at the Citizen Lab at the University of Toronto’s Munk School of Global Affairs, has been tracking the spread of spyware around the globe.

results.title: Born in the VCR Era, Great Courses Seeks to Evolve
results.abstract: With a new streaming service aimed at broadening its customers base, the company says it can be “the Netflix of learning.”

results.title: Dutch Firm Trains Eagles to Take Down High-Tech Prey: Drones
results.abstract: When small, off-the-shelf models pose security or other threats, birds have the advantage of grounding them without a potentially dangerous crash.

results.title: Putting Love to the Stress Test
results.abstract: When two self-described tech geeks slide into a relationship that seems too easy, they design a monthlong trial to expose its flaws.

results.title: How ‘Everything’ Became the Highest Form of Praise
results.abstract: How do you distinguish a photo, video or new product from the rest when they’re all hailed as the epitome of achievement?

results.title: B.J. Novak Thinks Actors Are Bad at Playing Writers
results.abstract: The actor and app developer on democratizing writing, why Ethan Hawke is too hot to be a writer and avenging his ghostwriter father’s anonymity.

results.abstract: Cooking apps, like SideChef and Yummly, guide you through the cooking experience and give access to thousands of recipes.

results.title: I Spy on My Own Wi-Fi
results.abstract: If you would like to see who (or what) is tapped into your wireless network, you can take a peek with router utilities and mobile apps.

results.title: Reviving a Sluggish iPhone
results.abstract: Forcibly quitting open apps or refreshing the phone’s random access memory might help speed up the device’s performance

results.title: Locating a Lost Windows Device
results.abstract: Like Apple and Google have done for their own gadgets, Microsoft has a way for users to track down missing Windows 10 hardware.

results.title: Going Wide With Google Camera
results.abstract: Google’s own camera app for Android can do much more than just snap standard still photos.
